comments:
Hello,

I am getting an error when I try to generate a Web Service Client. 

I am running a fresh install of Eclipse, with WTP installed via Help -> Software
Updates

Following the tutorials for Top-Down web service at:

http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/community/tutorials/TopDownWebService/TopDownWebService.html

and

http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/community/tutorials/WebServiceClient/WebServiceClient.html

I am able to generate the Web Service without problems. However, when I try to
generate the client I get an error:

IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured.

and the wizard stops working.

However, the client is generated and seems to work. If I point my web browser to

http://localhost:8080/areaClient/sampleAreaServiceProxy/Method.jsp

I am able to select the method 'calculateRectArea' which seems to be invoked OK.

Please let me know if you need any additional information.

Thanks in advance,

Hernan

This is the full text of the stack trace that the error generates:

Thanks Hernan, we'll have a look via bug 114167.
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
